qas.question: What four things did the Windows Everywhere campaign emphasize on?

context: In May 2013, Microsoft launched a new television campaign for Windows 8 illustrating the capabilities and pricing of Windows 8 tablets in comparison to <a1_0>the iPad<a1_0/>, which featured the voice of Siri remarking on <b6_0>the iPad<b6_0/>'s limitations in a parody of Apple's "Get a Mac" advertisements. On <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>June 12, 2013<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> during game 1 of the 2013 Stanley Cup Finals, Microsoft premiered the first ad in its "<a2_0><b7_0>Windows Everywhere<b7_0/><a2_0/>" campaign, which promoted <a3_0><b8_0>Windows 8, Windows Phone 8, and the company's suite of online services<b8_0/><a3_0/> as an interconnected platform.
